title: Letting companies supplant our goals
description: I felt pressured in a bad way by the social features of Fitbit. Not by my friends themselves, but the culture of competition and one goal for all it fostered. I stopped wearing a fitness band for a while, then when I needed to start tracking my heart rate, I created a new account without […]

title: On trying in spite of fear
description: I have both the need for my own pace to be listened to and the push of urgency from how quickly life moves. Very relatable. There’s also a patience needed, a trust in ourselves and the world that we’re not too late, that our project will still be relevant by the time we finally finish. […]

title: The question of democracy
description: The Shocking Voter Purge Crisis of Democracy Revealed by Thom Hartmann (The Hartmann Report) [M]ost of the [voter roll] purge activity was taking place in former Confederate Red states that — before five Republicans on the Supreme Court gutted the Voting Rights Act in their 2013 Shelby County decision — had to have purges pre-cleared […]
